org.apache.twill.api

Interface ResourceSpecification


  • public interface ResourceSpecification
    This interface provides specifications for resource requirements including set and get methods for number of cores, amount of memory, and number of instances.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  ResourceSpecification.Builder
      Builder for creating ResourceSpecification.
      static class  ResourceSpecification.SizeUnit
      Unit for specifying memory size.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static ResourceSpecification BASIC 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getCores()
      Deprecated. 
      int getDownlink()
      Returns the downlink bandwidth in Mbps.
      int getInstances()
      Returns number of execution instances.
      int getMemorySize()
      Returns the memory size in MB.
      int getUplink()
      Returns the uplink bandwidth in Mbps.
      int getVirtualCores()
      Returns the number of virtual CPU cores.

    • Method Detail

      • getCores

        @Deprecated
int getCores()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the number of virtual CPU cores. DEPRECATED, use getVirtualCores instead.
        Returns:
        Number of virtual CPU cores.

      • getVirtualCores

        int getVirtualCores()
        Returns the number of virtual CPU cores.
        Returns:
        Number of virtual CPU cores.

      • getMemorySize

        int getMemorySize()
        Returns the memory size in MB.
        Returns:
        Memory size

      • getUplink

        int getUplink()
        Returns the uplink bandwidth in Mbps.
        Returns:
        Uplink bandwidth or -1 representing unlimited bandwidth.

      • getDownlink

        int getDownlink()
        Returns the downlink bandwidth in Mbps.
        Returns:
        Downlink bandwidth or -1 representing unlimited bandwidth.

      • getInstances

        int getInstances()
        Returns number of execution instances.
        Returns:
